rationales.self_direction: He actively searches for a style that feels like his own rather than only reproducing inherited patterns.
rationales.tradition: His decision space is explicitly anchored in family workshop legacy and Opa's established craft norms.

rationales.self_direction: He experiments with a hybrid visual language and considers a gallery route on his own artistic terms.
rationales.tradition: He grounds meaning in choir repertoire and workshop continuity that connect him to long-standing local practice.
He rejects commodified imitation because it erases makers, and he defends craft lineage as the core meaning of the work.
A historical photo of his great-grandfather at the same bench anchors his identity in multigenerational workshop continuity.

rationales.self_direction: He initiates the gallery path while trying to define a week-to-week model that includes both practices.
rationales.tradition: He filters gallery participation through family standards about preserving name and craft integrity.
Learning that his grandmother sang the same motet creates a direct inherited thread he experiences as meaningful continuity.
He resists a presentation context that makes his work feel detached from its origins in workshop heritage.

rationales.self_direction: He explicitly rejects total role capture by inherited community expectations, saying he would 'suffocate' in that clarity.
rationales.tradition: His reflections are still grounded in historical church craft and communal service models.

rationales.self_direction: He leans toward accepting the show, moving toward an independently chosen artistic direction.
rationales.tradition: The shift is legitimized through family lineage when Opa connects the choice to Oma.

rationales.conformity: He openly pushes back against proposed repertoire change and withdraws from usual social routine afterward.
rationales.tradition: He defends older sacred music as a living inheritance worth preserving.

rationales.self_direction: He commits to a personally authored middle path by curating work that bridges workshop heritage and contemporary expression.
rationales.tradition: He treats faithful restoration methods and intergenerational workshop practices as essential, not incidental.
